loading_modules.name: Gironda’s 6×6 — ~6 min per exercise
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6 sets x ~10s each + 30s rest between sets ≈ 6 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 6 sets of 6 reps with the same weight, resting only 20–30s between sets. Use around your 8–10RM. Focus on short rests to accumulate volume under fatigue.
loading_modules.example_application: Barbell Curl 6×6 @ 50 lb, 30s rest. Once you can do all sets, add ~5%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Emphasize strict form. Avoid failure on the early sets so you can complete all 6 sets. Effective for hypertrophy via high training density.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 6 sets × 6 reps = 36 total reps

loading_modules.name: FST-7 (Fascia Stretch Training) — ~8 min finisher
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 7 sets x ~20s each + 45s rest x 6 ≈ 8 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick an isolation exercise as a finisher. Perform 7 sets of 8–12 reps with short rests (30–45s), maximizing pump and tension. Incorporate brief flexing or stretching between sets.
loading_modules.example_application: Leg Extensions, 7×10 @ 100 lb, ~40s rest. Pose or stretch quads between sets.
loading_modules.important_notes: Stay hydrated; rest is minimal. Typically done at the end of a workout. Aim for a deep pump. Great for hypertrophy ‘finishing’ effects.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 7 sets × ~10 reps = 70 total reps

loading_modules.name: German Volume Training (10×10) — ~20 min per exercise
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 sets × ~20s each + 60s rest × 9 ≈ 20 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 10 sets of 10 reps with a ~60% 1RM load. Rest ~60–90s between sets. Increase the load once all 10 sets are completed successfully.
loading_modules.example_application: Bench Press 10×10 @ 135 lb, 60s rest. Progress by 5 lb increments if all reps are achieved.
loading_modules.important_notes: Highly taxing approach. Typically do just one GVT exercise per muscle group. Deload after ~4-6 weeks to avoid overtraining.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 10 sets × 10 reps = 100 total reps

loading_modules.name: Reverse Pyramid Training — ~12 min per exercise
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets: heavy ~20s + 2-3 min rest; medium ~30s + 2 min rest; light ~40s
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Start heavy for 6 reps, rest 2-3 min, reduce weight ~10-15% for ~8 reps, rest 2 min, then reduce again for ~10 reps. Increase top set weight once you hit the upper rep goals smoothly.
loading_modules.example_application: Squat: 6×300 lb, 8×270 lb, 10×240 lb. When 6-8-10 is easy, raise top set weight.
loading_modules.important_notes: First set is the heaviest, subsequent sets reduce load but increase reps. Strict rest times are key for consistency.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: ~24 total reps (6+8+10).

loading_modules.name: 20-Rep Breathing Squat — ~5 min set
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 1 extended set of ~20 reps taking ~3-5 min (with breaths)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use a 10RM load but do 20 reps by pausing to take deep breaths between reps past rep 10. Aim to add 5-10 lb each session if you complete all 20.
loading_modules.example_application: Squat 200 lb for 20 reps. Rest 3-5 deep breaths between reps after the 10th rep.
loading_modules.important_notes: Extremely taxing; used for short cycles (6 weeks). Typically combined with a high-calorie diet for mass gains.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 1 set × 20 reps.

loading_modules.name: Dynamic Effort Method – Upper Body (~10 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 9 sets x ~5s + ~45s rest = 9-10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 9×3 of fast, explosive bench presses at ~50-60% 1RM plus bands/chains. Rest 30-60s between sets, focusing on maximal bar speed.
loading_modules.example_application: Bench Press: 9×3 @ 50% + 25% band tension, 45s rest each. 3-week wave: 50-55-60%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Keep the weight submaximal; velocity is key. If bar speed slows, slightly increase rest or reduce load.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 9 sets × 3 reps = 27 total speed reps

loading_modules.name: Dynamic Effort Method – Lower Body (~8 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 sets x ~4s + 30s rest = ~8 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform ~8-10 sets of 2 reps for squats or deadlifts at 50-70% 1RM plus bands/chains, focusing on speed. Short rest intervals (~30-60s).
loading_modules.example_application: Box Squat: 10×2 @ 60% 1RM + chain, 30-45s rest. 3-week wave: 50→55→60%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Designed to enhance rate of force development. Keep loads submaximal, focusing on explosive execution.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: E.g., 10 sets × 2 reps = 20 dynamic reps

loading_modules.name: Max Effort Ramp to 1RM — ~15 min
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5-8 progressively heavier singles, ~2 min rest each ≈15 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: After warm-ups, ramp up in singles to find a daily or weekly 1RM. Stop if form breaks down or if you fail. Rotate main lift variation each 1-2 weeks.
loading_modules.example_application: Box Squat ramp: 135×5, 225×3, 315×1, 365×1, 385×1 (max). Next session: choose a slight variation or go heavier if recovered.
loading_modules.important_notes: Requires good technique and spotters. Typically used by advanced lifters. Very taxing; limit volume or add accessory after.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 1-2 top singles per session, plus warm-ups

loading_modules.name: Texas Method Weekly (5×5 Volume + 1×5 Intensity)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Volume day: 5×5 (~15-20 min). Intensity day: ramp to 1×5 (~10 min).
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Monday: 5×5 across at ~90% 5RM (volume). Wednesday: light recovery. Friday: ramp to new 5RM (intensity). Increase weight weekly if possible.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: Mon 5×5 @ 300 lb, Fri 1×5 @ 320 lb. Week 2: Mon 5×5 @ 300 lb, Fri 1×5 @ 325 lb.
loading_modules.important_notes: Intermediate approach bridging linear progression. Heavy volume day must not be to absolute failure; keep a rep in reserve.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Volume day: 5×5 = 25 reps; Intensity day: 1×5 = 5 reps

loading_modules.name: Bulgarian Method Daily Max
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Work up to daily training max (6-10 singles incl. warm-ups)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Train the same lift daily, ramp to a top single at ~RPE 9. If strong, push slightly above. Often do 1-2 back-off sets at ~90%.
loading_modules.example_application: Daily squats: ramp to a crisp single (405 lb), maybe 2×2 @ 365 lb. Next day, repeat or adjust by feel.
loading_modules.important_notes: Advanced method requiring excellent recovery. Avoid grinding lifts daily to prevent burnout.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: ~1 top single daily, plus ramp sets

loading_modules.name: Smolov Jr. 3-Week High Volume Blast
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6-10 sets per session, ~60-90 min incl. rests
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: 4 workouts weekly for one lift. Ex: 6×6@70%, 7×5@75%, 8×4@80%, 10×3@85%. Each week add 5-10 lb. After 3 weeks, test a new max.
loading_modules.important_notes: High volume specialization. Very taxing. Emphasize recovery. Typically done for squat or bench only.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Example: 6×6 + 7×5 + 8×4 + 10×3 = 154 reps in a single week

loading_modules.name: Hepburn Method Power Progression (8×2→8×3)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 8 sets x ~20s + 2-3 min rest each ≈25 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Choose a ~90% 1RM load for 8×2. Each session, add a rep to one of the sets until all are 8×3. Then increase weight ~5-10 lb and repeat.
loading_modules.example_application: Bench: 8×2@300. Next session: 7×2,1×3@300. Eventually 8×3@300, then move to 310 lb at 8×2.
loading_modules.important_notes: Slow, steady progression. Don’t force reps. Usually combined with lighter accessory (3×6-8) after the heavy work.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 16 reps at start (8×2) to 24 reps at end (8×3).

loading_modules.name: Heavy/Light/Medium 3-Day Split (HLM)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 days/week, ~3-5 exercises/day, ~60 min each
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Train 3x/week. One heavy day (5×5 near 5RM), one light day (2×5 ~70%), and one medium day (3×5 ~85%). Cycle intensity across main lifts for balanced development.
loading_modules.example_application: Squat: Monday (heavy 5×5@315), Wed (light 2×5@225), Fri (medium 3×5@270).
loading_modules.important_notes: Allows recovery with light/medium days. Good for intermediates. Adjust percentages as you progress.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: ~25 reps on heavy day, ~10 on light day, ~15 on medium = 50 total weekly reps per lift

loading_modules.name: BFR Occlusion Training (30-15-15-15)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 BFR sets, 30s rest each, cuff on entire time ≈5 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Apply occlusion strap. Perform 30 reps, rest ~30s, 15 reps, rest, 15 reps, rest, 15 reps. Remove strap after all sets.
loading_modules.example_application: Leg Extension: 30,15,15,15 with ~20%1RM. Keep the muscle engorged with minimal rest.
loading_modules.important_notes: Improves hypertrophy at low loads. Watch for excessive pain/numbness. Good for joint-friendly isolation.

loading_modules.name: Rep Goal System (Flexible Sets)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Perform multiple sets until target reps reached
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick a total rep target (e.g., 25). Perform as many sets as needed with the same weight until 25 reps are reached. Increase weight once you can reach the target in fewer sets.
loading_modules.example_application: Dumbbell Curl, aim 30 total reps: 15, 10, 5. Next time try 55 lb for sets of ~12, 9, etc.
loading_modules.important_notes: Helps auto-regulate on good/bad days. Keep track of sets to measure progression.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: E.g., total 25-30 reps per exercise per session

loading_modules.name: 5/3/1 (Original) — 4-Week Cycle
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 main sets plus optional final AMRAP set (~15-20 min lift focus)
loading_modules.train_to_failure: no, but close on last set
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use a training max = 90% of true 1RM. Week1: 65%×5, 75%×5, 85%×5+ (AMRAP). Week2: 70%×3, 80%×3, 90%×3+. Week3: 75%×5, 85%×3, 95%×1+. Week4 is a deload. Then add 5-10 lb to the training max and repeat.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on slow, steady progression. Last set can be pushed close to failure for AMRAP. Minimal accessory or a chosen template can be added.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Main sets each day: 3 sets plus optional additional reps on last set

loading_modules.name: 5/3/1 + First Set Last (FSL) Variation
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Main sets ~10 min + FSL volume ~10-15 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Same main progression as original 5/3/1. After final main set, drop back to the first set’s percentage (~65-70%) for 5×5 (FSL). This adds volume for hypertrophy.
loading_modules.important_notes: FSL is powerful for extra volume. Keep rest moderate so you can handle the 5×5. Deload every 4th week.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 main sets + 5 additional sets = 8 total sets for the main lift

loading_modules.name: DC Training (Doggcrapp) – Rest-Pause Hypertrophy
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 1 extended rest-pause set, ~2-3 mini-sets with 10-15s rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick a load for ~6-8 reps to failure. Perform reps to failure, rack for 10-15s, resume to failure again, rack, final mini-set to failure. Try to total 11-15 reps across 3 mini-sets. Progress load or reps over time.
loading_modules.example_application: Incline DB Press: 1st set 8 reps, rest 15s, 2nd set 3 reps, rest, 3rd set 2 reps = 13 total (in 3 mini-sets).
loading_modules.important_notes: High-intensity approach. Low exercise selection (one exercise per bodypart each session). Use extreme stretches post-set.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Effectively 1 main rest-pause set per exercise, 3 mini-sets.

loading_modules.name: Juggernaut Method (4 Waves, 16 Weeks)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Main work ~15-20 min, additional volume ~15-20 min
loading_modules.autoregulated: yes (adjust next wave based on rep performance)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Wave 1 uses sets of 10, wave 2 uses 8, wave 3 uses 5, wave 4 uses 3. Each wave is ~3-4 weeks. The final set each week is an AMRAP. Performance on AMRAP adjusts your training max for next wave.
loading_modules.example_application: Wave 1 (10s): Wk1 60%, Wk2 65%, Wk3 70%, each finishing with AMRAP. Then wave 2 (8s) at higher %.
loading_modules.important_notes: Complex but effective periodization bridging volume & intensity. Great for intermediate lifters needing structured progress.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each wave: 3 weeks of build + 1 deload. Main sets vary from ~3-5 sets plus 1 AMRAP.

loading_modules.name: Bill Starr 5×5 (Linear Progression)
loading_modules.intensity_range: Work up in sets to a top set of 5
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~40s each + rests = ~15-20 min per main lift
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Classic 5×5 with ramping: e.g. 50%, 60%, 70%, 80%, 90% for sets of 5, reaching a top set. Increase top set weekly if successful.
loading_modules.example_application: Squat: 135×5, 185×5, 225×5, 275×5, 315×5 (top). Next week aim 320 for top set.
loading_modules.important_notes: Don’t overshoot on early sets. The final set is the main driver. Good for novices/intermediates adding weight weekly.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 25 total reps (5 sets × 5) per main lift.

loading_modules.name: 5/3/1 – 5s Pro Variation
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets ~5 reps each, plus optional supplemental
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Each main set is exactly 5 reps at 65, 75, 85% (Week1), 70, 80, 90% (Week2), 75, 85, 95% (Week3). But you only do 5 reps, no AMRAP. Deload in week4, then increase TM.
loading_modules.example_application: Week1 Squat: 65%×5, 75%×5, 85%×5 (no extra reps). Next weeks: +5-10% each wave.
loading_modules.important_notes: Highly submaximal, focusing on form and volume consistency. Usually paired with deeper volume work (e.g. Boring But Big).
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets x 5 reps = 15 reps per main lift

loading_modules.name: German Body Composition (GBC)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Supersets with short rests, about 25-30 min of main work
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Alternate upper & lower exercises in supersets (A1/A2) with minimal rest (~30s) to boost metabolic stress and fat-burning. Typically 3-4 supersets of 8-15 reps each.
loading_modules.example_application: A1: Front Squat 10 reps, rest 30s, A2: Chin-ups 10 reps, rest 30s, repeat for 3-4 rounds.
loading_modules.important_notes: Short rest, emphasis on hypertrophy and metabolic effect. Good for body recomposition phases.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each superset ~8-15 reps × 3-4 sets per exercise

loading_modules.name: Triple Progression Model (6-8 reps, 3 sets)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~30s each + 90s-120s rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Select a weight you can do for 3×6. Each week aim to progress reps up to 3×8. Once you can do 3×8 with good form, increase the weight and return to 3×6.
loading_modules.example_application: DB Shoulder Press: 50 lb x 3×6. Next session try 3×7. Once you can do 3×8, go to 55 lb x 3×6.
loading_modules.important_notes: Simple progressive overload. Great for beginner/intermediate lifters. Manage rest intervals (90-120s) consistently.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets, up to 24 total reps at top end

loading_modules.name: 6-12-25 Method (Poliquin)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Each tri-set ~2-3 min total + rest, repeated 3 times
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick 3 exercises for the same muscle. First do 6 reps heavy, then immediately 12 reps moderately loaded, then 25 reps lighter, with minimal rest between. Rest 2-3 min, repeat for 3 total tri-sets.
loading_modules.example_application: Chest: A1: DB Bench 6 reps, A2: Incline Press 12 reps, A3: Cable Fly 25 reps, rest 2 min, repeat x2.
loading_modules.important_notes: Intense metabolic stress. Good short cycle for hypertrophy shock. Usually done on single muscle focus.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each tri-set = 6+12+25=43 reps, repeated 3 times = 129 reps total

loading_modules.name: 4×8 Linear Progression — ~8 min
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x ~40s each + ~60s rest = ~8 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 4 sets of 8 reps with the same weight. If you complete all sets, add weight next session. Rest ~60–90s. Emphasize consistent form.
loading_modules.example_application: Lat Pulldown 4×8 @ 120 lb. Next session attempt 125 lb if all sets were completed at 120 lb.
loading_modules.important_notes: Simple linear approach for muscle growth. Manage rest carefully. Once progress slows, consider a brief deload or rep range change.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets × 8 reps = 32 reps

loading_modules.name: 4×8 Wave Loading (~2 waves of 2 sets)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets × ~20-30s each + rests ~2 min
loading_modules.autoregulated: yes (increment 2nd wave if 1st wave feels good)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Wave 1: 2 sets of 8 (70%). Wave 2: Increase weight (75-80%) for another 2 sets of 8. Attempt a slight load bump on wave 2 each session if wave 1 is comfortable.
loading_modules.example_application: Wave1: 100 lb×8, 100 lb×8, then Wave2: 105 lb×8, 110 lb×8. Next session try to push wave2 further if possible.
loading_modules.important_notes: Helps progressive overload in small increments. Keep rest about 2 min between sets so you can maintain form.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets total, each 8 reps => 32 reps

loading_modules.name: 8-6-4-2 Wave Loading
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x ~20-30s + 2-3 min rest each
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 8 reps at a moderate load, rest 2-3 min, 6 reps heavier, rest, 4 reps heavier, rest, final 2 reps the heaviest. Optionally do multiple waves if advanced (e.g. 2 waves of 8-6-4-2).
loading_modules.example_application: Bench: 8×185, 6×205, 4×225, 2×245. Next session attempt small load increases if successful.
loading_modules.important_notes: Good for bridging hypertrophy & strength. Manage rest well. Over multiple sessions, wave up the loads steadily.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 8+6+4+2=20 total reps in the wave

loading_modules.name: Escalating Density Training (EDT) — 15 min PR Zone
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: One ‘PR zone’ of 15 min, alternating two exercises
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Choose 2 exercises (often antagonistic). Set a 15 min timer. Alternate sets of 5-10 reps, resting just enough to maintain form. Record total reps completed. Next session, beat that total.
loading_modules.example_application: A1: Chin-up, A2: Dips, 15 min. Score = 50 total chin-ups + 50 total dips = 100 reps. Next time aim 105+ total.
loading_modules.important_notes: Keep each mini-set sub-failure so you can sustain. Great for hypertrophy and conditioning. A “PR Zone” approach fosters incremental progress.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: All sets done within 15 min, aim to exceed prior total reps each session

loading_modules.name: Density Training – 10-Min AMRAP
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: One 10 min continuous block of repeated short sets
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick a movement and load. In 10 min, do as many total reps as possible in small sets (e.g., sets of 3-5). Rest briefly as needed to keep form. Tally total reps. Try to improve next session.
loading_modules.example_application: 10-min AMRAP Back Squat @ 135 lb. Perform sets of 5, rest ~15s, go again. Score = total reps in 10 min.
loading_modules.important_notes: Manage pacing. Don’t burn out too quickly. Useful for hypertrophy and GPP. Keep consistent form as fatigue sets in.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Total reps completed in 10 min

loading_modules.name: Rest-Pause (Dorian Yates-Inspired)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Each set ~ 1 min total, with mini-rests of ~15-20s
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick a heavy weight for ~6-8 reps to failure. Rack for ~15s, then do as many reps as possible again. Repeat 1-2 mini-rest segments. Typically 1 all-out rest-pause set per exercise.
loading_modules.example_application: Incline Press: 8 reps to failure @ 200 lb, rest 15s, 3 reps, rest 15s, 2 reps. Done.
loading_modules.important_notes: Extremely intense; not for beginners. Low volume, high effort. Good for advanced hypertrophy cycles.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each main set yields ~2-3 mini-bursts, total ~12-15 reps

loading_modules.name: Power Clusters (6×2 @ ~90%)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6 sets x 2 reps with short intra-set rest (~20s)
loading_modules.rest_pause: yes (very short rest between reps or doubles)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Load ~90% 1RM. Perform 2 reps, rack for 15-20s, do 2 more, etc. Typically 6 total reps or multiple sets (6×2) with ~2 min rest between sets. Clusters let you handle heavier weight for more explosive reps.
loading_modules.example_application: Cluster squat: 6 sets of 2 reps with 2 min between sets. Or do 2 reps, rack 15s, 2 reps, rack 15s, etc. for a single cluster ‘set.’
loading_modules.important_notes: Improves power near max loads without excessive fatigue. Keep technique crisp. Good for advanced lifters.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 12 total reps at ~90% across 6 sets

loading_modules.name: Hypertrophy Clusters (4×4 w/ short rests)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 cluster sets, each ~20-30s in duration, with short rests
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use ~80%. Each set: do 1 rep, rack 10s, 1 rep, rack 10s, total 4 reps (a cluster of singles). That is 1 cluster set. Do 4 cluster sets. Rest ~2 min between sets.
loading_modules.example_application: Cluster bench: 80%1RM, set1 = (rep, 10s rest, rep, 10s, rep, 10s, rep). Then 2 min rest. Repeat 4 total cluster sets.
loading_modules.important_notes: Allows heavier loads than normal 4×4 because you partially recover between reps. Useful for building strength-hypertrophy synergy.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each cluster set = 4 reps, 4 total sets => 16 reps at heavier load

loading_modules.name: Myo-Reps (Autoregulated Mini-Sets)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: One main activation set + multiple mini-sets (3-5 reps) with ~10s rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Choose a weight for 10-20 reps as an activation set. Go near failure, rest 10s, do a mini-set of 3-5 reps. Continue mini-sets (with 10s rest) until speed or reps drop. Log total reps.
loading_modules.example_application: Chest press machine: 15 reps (activation), rest 10s, 5 reps, rest 10s, 4 reps, rest 10s, 4 reps, final 3 reps. Stop if rep speed slows too much.
loading_modules.important_notes: Good for hypertrophy with minimal volume. Track total reps and aim to improve over sessions. Great on machines or stable exercises.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 1 extended set can yield 20-30 total reps

loading_modules.name: Advanced Drop Set (3 drops)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: One set ~60-90s total, minimal rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Choose a weight for 8-10 reps to failure. Immediately reduce 10-20% and go to failure again. Drop one more time (3 total ‘tiers’).
loading_modules.example_application: DB Lateral Raise: 20 lb ×10 reps, drop to 15 lb ×7 reps, drop to 10 lb ×6 reps. All performed with minimal rest.
loading_modules.important_notes: Very taxing for the muscle, usually used as a finisher. Keep good form. Typically 1 drop set per muscle group is enough.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: ~3 mini-sets in rapid succession

loading_modules.name: Mechanics Drop Set
loading_modules.intensity_range: Same load, easier angles each shift
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: One extended set ~60s
loading_modules.amrap: yes (each mechanical variant to near failure)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use the same weight but shift your body or limb position to a stronger mechanical advantage after failing the weaker variation. Typically 2-3 shifts in one set.
loading_modules.example_application: Shoulder trifecta: Start with standing lateral raise to failure, then partial side raises (top half) to failure, then upright row with same DB to failure.
loading_modules.important_notes: Great for advanced hypertrophy. Minimizes setup changes. Keep each shift safe and maintain form.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: One extended set with 2-3 mechanical variations

loading_modules.name: Ladder Sets (1-2-3 up to 3-2-1)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Perform cyclical reps in ascending then descending order
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Do 1 rep, rest, 2 reps, rest, 3 reps, rest, then repeat. Possibly up to 5 reps. This is one ladder. Do multiple ladders. Often used with limited rest to accumulate volume without burning out quickly.
loading_modules.example_application: Pull-ups: 1 rep, rest ~10s, 2 reps, rest, 3 reps, rest, repeat. If you can’t complete the top rung, reduce the max rung or total ladders.
loading_modules.important_notes: Excellent for practicing submax sets with cumulative volume. Great for skill-based lifts or bodyweight progressions.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each ladder rung total: 1+2+3=6 reps. Doing 3 ladders = 18 reps total, etc.

loading_modules.name: 6-4-2 Wave Loading
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets, 2-3 min rest each
loading_modules.autoregulated: yes (can do multiple waves if advanced)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform a set of 6 at moderate load, rest 2-3 min, 4 heavier, rest, 2 at near-max. Optionally do a second wave with slightly heavier loads if performance allows.
loading_modules.example_application: Deadlift: 6×315, 4×335, 2×355. If strong, do a second wave: 6×320, 4×340, 2×360.
loading_modules.important_notes: Stop if bar speed slows drastically. Great for bridging strength & hypertrophy. Typically 1-2 waves per session per lift.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 12 reps per wave

loading_modules.name: 5-4-3-2-1 Wave for Strength
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~20s each + 2-3 min rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Start at ~80% for 5 reps, increase load each set for 4,3,2, and final 1 near 95%. Possibly do 2 waves if advanced, adding weight each wave.
loading_modules.example_application: Squat: 5×225, 4×245, 3×265, 2×280, 1×295. Next wave: add ~5 lb each set if able.
loading_modules.important_notes: Effective for intermediate lifters needing a structured heavy approach. Keep rest 2-3 min minimum to maintain strength.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5+4+3+2+1 = 15 total reps in one wave

loading_modules.name: Big 3 Ramp 3×5 (Squat/Bench/Dead)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 main sets x ~5 reps each + rest ~2 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Hit 3 ascending sets of 5 on the big lifts. E.g. 70%×5, 80%×5, 90%×5. If the top set is successful, slightly increase next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Simple ramp used in many strength programs. Keep rest 2-3 minutes. Good for quick progression without excessive volume.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets × 5 reps = 15 total

loading_modules.name: Omni-Contraction Training (multi-tempo)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x 8-12 reps, each with a distinct tempo emphasis
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: 1st set: normal tempo (~2-0-1). 2nd set: slow negative (~4-1-1). 3rd set: explosive concentric (~2-0-X). All around 8-12 reps at moderate load, resting ~60-90s between sets.
loading_modules.example_application: Biceps curl: Set1 normal 8 reps, Set2 4s negative 8 reps, Set3 explosive up 8 reps. Increase weight if easy.
loading_modules.important_notes: Aims to hit muscle from multiple contraction speeds. Great variation for short hypertrophy blocks.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets × 8-12 reps = 24-36 reps

loading_modules.name: Dr. Israetel’s Hypertrophy Mesocycle (8-12 reps)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Multiple exercises x 3-4 sets each, 8-12 reps
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Week 1 start ~3 RIR. Each week add volume (an extra set) or load to maintain ~2 RIR. By final week, you’re at ~1 RIR or 0 RIR. Then deload.
loading_modules.example_application: Leg Day: 4 sets of squats (8-12 reps, ~3 RIR). Next week, 5 sets or slight load increase, keep reps in 8-12 but RIR ~2, etc.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on incremental overload, track RIR carefully. Suited to moderate volume hypertrophy.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Total sets per muscle 10→15+ across mesocycle

loading_modules.name: Incremental Volume Build (3 sets to 5 sets over weeks)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3-5 sets x ~12 reps each plus rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Week1: 3 sets of 8-12. Week2: 4 sets. Week3: 5 sets. Each set near 1-2 RIR. Week4: deload or reduce sets. Then repeat with heavier loads or new rep range.
loading_modules.example_application: Overhead Press: W1 = 3×10@60 lb, W2=4×10@60 lb, W3=5×10@60 lb, W4=2×10@50 lb (deload). Then progress load next cycle.
loading_modules.important_notes: Gradually increases volume to spur hypertrophy. Keep form consistent. Best for intermediate lifters needing cyclical volume.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Session sets ramp 3 → 4 → 5 (8-12 reps each).

loading_modules.name: Single/Triple/Five Progression
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x <1 min total each + rests
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform a heavy single, rest 2-3 min, reduce weight ~10% for a triple, rest, reduce ~10% again for 5 reps. Over time, attempt to increase each load or reduce the percentage drop.
loading_modules.example_application: Deadlift: 1×365, 3×325, 5×295. Next session aim heavier single or smaller drop for triple/five.
loading_modules.important_notes: Combines heavy strength work with moderate volume. Good for intermediates short on time. Avoid failing the single.

loading_modules.name: Y3T (Neil Hill) – 3-Week Cycle
loading_modules.intensity_range: From heavy to moderate-high to very high reps
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4-5 exercises per muscle, sets vary, each week rep ranges shift
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Week1: heavier loads, 6-10 reps. Week2: moderate loads, 10-14 reps. Week3: lighter loads, 20+ reps. This cycles hypertrophy stimuli to shock growth. Then repeat.
loading_modules.example_application: Legs: W1 (6-10), W2(10-14), W3(20-25). Adjust loads so you approach failure in each range.
loading_modules.important_notes: Intense. Variation in rep ranges helps overall hypertrophy. Each cycle is 3 weeks, then you can repeat with heavier loads.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Total sets depends on exercise selection and intensities each week

loading_modules.name: GZCL Method (T1/T2/T3 Layers)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: T1 main lift ~15 min, T2 10-15 min, T3 5-10 min
loading_modules.train_to_failure: no (1-2 RIR in T1/T2, T3 can push further)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Tier1 = main heavy lift (1-5 reps). Tier2 = secondary lifts (6-10 reps). Tier3 = accessories (10-20 reps). Each tier has a target total rep range. Increase weight or reps once you hit target consistently.
loading_modules.example_application: Squat T1: 3×3 heavy, T2: 3×8 front squat moderate, T3: 3×12 lunges. Each tier hits volume goals.
loading_modules.important_notes: Great for well-rounded strength & size. Flexible. Keep track of rep goals per tier and progress systematically.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Tier1 ~10-15 reps, Tier2 ~20-30 reps, Tier3 ~30+ reps

loading_modules.name: The Bear Routine (5×5 + 5×5 back-off)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 heavy sets, short rest, 5 back-off sets with minimal rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Do 5×5 at around 80% 1RM with ~2-3 min rest. Then drop 10-15% and do another 5×5 with only ~1 min rest between sets. Attempt to maintain form throughout.
loading_modules.example_application: Deadlift: 5×5 @ 315 (2 min rest), then 5×5 @ 280 (1 min rest). If successful, increase weight next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: High volume. Increases both strength and size. Watch for fatigue accumulation. Typically used for one main lift per session.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 10 sets × 5 reps = 50 total reps

loading_modules.name: Gironda’s 8×8 Method
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 8 sets x ~15s each + 15-20s rest each = 8 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Extremely short rest intervals (15-20s). Use about 60% 1RM for 8 reps, quickly rest, repeat for 8 total sets, chasing a deep burn.
loading_modules.example_application: Barbell Curl 8×8 @ 40 lb, 15s rest. If you can complete all sets with good form, increase weight next time.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus is on muscle density and definition. Very demanding metabolically. Keep strict form.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 8×8 = 64 reps

loading_modules.name: 4×12 — ~6 min per exercise
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x ~30s each + ~60s rest
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Simple hypertrophy approach: do 4 sets of 12 reps with the same weight, rest ~60-90s. Increase weight once all sets are completed successfully.
loading_modules.example_application: Shoulder Press 4×12 @ 60 lb, next session 65 lb if you can do all 4 sets of 12.
loading_modules.important_notes: Higher rep range fosters muscle endurance and hypertrophy. Good for accessory lifts or moderate-intensity days.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets × 12 reps = 48 total reps

loading_modules.name: 5×8 Linear Progression
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~30s each + 90s rest = ~10 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 5 sets of 8 with the same load. Once you can handle all 5×8 confidently, add 5 lb next session.
loading_modules.example_application: Barbell Row: 5×8 @ 135 lb, progress to 140 lb next time if all sets are done with good form.
loading_modules.important_notes: Straightforward progressive overload. Good volume for hypertrophy without extremes.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets × 8 reps = 40 total reps

loading_modules.name: 5/3/1 Boring But Big Variation
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Main sets ~10 min + BBB 5×10 ~10-15 min
loading_modules.train_to_failure: no, but near on last BBB sets
loading_modules.autoregulated: yes (if you fail BBB volume, reduce load)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Run standard 5/3/1 sets (3 sets). Then do 5×10 at ~50% of TM for the same lift (or an alternate). E.g. bench day: 5/3/1 bench + 5×10 bench at 50%.
loading_modules.example_application: Week1 (65/75/85% for 5s), then 5×10 @ 50%. Increase accessory load slowly if 5×10 is easy.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on big volume after main sets, so watch recovery. Keep rest short for BBB sets. A classic hypertrophy variation of 5/3/1.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 main working sets + 5 sets of 10 = 8 total sets
